response.overview: A perfectly logical camera placement renders action as a visual paradox rooted in the analogue world where image and sound took up physical space and required movement to be revealed. We ride alone with the worldâ€™s most famous piece of music watching an image that is both still and moving at the same time. Sound and image in this film are on a collision course as there is not enough space for both on the surface on the record. We literally hear until we get there. Hear to There is a lighthearted visual parable that raises questions about the representation and relationship of image and sound.
response.title: Hear To There
